source: 211 Illinois, Illinois Department of Veterans Affairs, and related veteran service organizations

resources.name: 211 Illinois
resources.description: Statewide 211 service connecting Illinois residents to health and human services including housing, utilities, employment, food assistance, mental health, and healthcare referrals. Available 24/7 via phone, text, chat, and online search.

resources.name: 211 Metro Chicago
resources.description: Free, comprehensive service connecting Cook County residents to health and social services 24/7/365. Connects to housing, food, employment, education, healthcare, mental health, crisis services, disability services, legal assistance, and reentry programs.

resources.name: Illinois Department of Veterans Affairs - Central Office
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive veteran services including education, employment support, healthcare resources, housing, long-term care, financial assistance, and legal services. Operates five veterans' homes and manages statewide VSO network.

resources.name: Veterans' Home at Anna
resources.description: One of five Illinois veterans' homes providing skilled and domiciliary long-term care. Offers quality skilled care and homelike environment to aging and disabled veterans.

resources.name: Veterans' Home at Chicago
resources.address: 4250 N. Oak Park Avenue, Chicago, IL 60634
resources.description: Illinois veterans' home providing skilled and domiciliary care. Offers quality long-term care services in a homelike environment for aging and disabled veterans.

resources.name: Veterans' Home at LaSalle
resources.description: One of five Illinois veterans' homes providing skilled and domiciliary long-term care with quality services and homelike environment.

resources.name: Veterans' Home at Manteno
resources.description: Illinois veterans' home providing skilled and domiciliary care. Also houses the Prince Home program (temporarily closed for renovation to serve women veterans, expected to reopen early 2026).

resources.name: Veterans' Home at Quincy
resources.description: One of five Illinois veterans' homes providing skilled and domiciliary long-term care (established 1886). Offers quality care and homelike environment.

resources.name: Prince Home at Manteno
resources.description: Residential facility for homeless and disabled veterans providing housing and supportive services for veterans coping with PTSD, substance abuse, and other challenges. Temporarily closed for renovation to serve unhoused women veterans (expected to reopen early 2026).

resources.name: IL-AFLAN (Illinois Armed Forces Legal Aid Network)
resources.description: Free statewide legal aid network for veterans, service members, National Guard, reservists, and families with low to moderate income. Provides legal advice, document preparation, discharge upgrades, VA benefits appeals, and civil legal assistance (family law, housing, consumer issues). Available 9am-4:30pm Monday-Friday.

resources.name: Veterans Assistance Commission of Cook County
resources.address: Juvenile Temporary Detention Center, 1100 S. Hamilton C-O11 (Lower Level), Chicago, IL 60612
resources.description: Serves Cook County veterans with immediate crisis relief and benefits navigation. Provides emergency financial assistance, VA benefits and claims advocacy, information and referral services for housing, employment, mental health, education, and legal aid.

resources.name: Midwest Shelter for Homeless Veterans (MSHV)
resources.description: Non-profit organization founded in 2007 ending veteran homelessness through housing, supportive services, and community outreach. Serves 500+ veteran households annually. Operates the Army Capt. Kevin C. Landeck Freedom Commissary providing clothing, household items, and basic needs.

resources.name: Volunteers of America Illinois - Veteran Services
resources.description: Founded in 1896, provides affordable housing for veterans who are homeless or in serious instability. Operates Hope Manor housing developments, Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF), and Hope Hall Veterans Transitional Housing.

resources.name: Veterans New Beginnings
resources.phone: Contact via Chicago Housing Authority or vnbchicago.org
resources.description: 54-unit supportive housing development in Auburn Gresham providing rental assistance to homeless veterans. Offers furnished studios, on-site supportive services, job training placement, life skill development, drug and alcohol counseling, and nutrition services.

resources.name: Greater Chicago Food Depository - Veteran Programs
resources.description: Provides food assistance to veterans through veteran food pantries with fresh produce, dairy, meat, and nonperishable items. Veteran food pantries housed in Illinois VA facilities. Participates in Veterans Stand Down events twice yearly offering food, housing resources, medical care, and clothing.

resources.name: Illinois JobLink (IJL)
resources.address: Online service - Illinois Department of Employment Security
resources.description: Free online job search platform with veterans receiving priority access. Connects veterans to job openings statewide and nationally. Highlights veteran status on resumes to help employers identify candidates. Includes support services locator (transportation, childcare).

resources.name: Illinois Work Net
resources.description: Workforce development system offering job-seeker tools through community colleges, libraries, and career centers. Provides resume assistance, career exploration guides, and support services locator.

resources.name: The American Legion - Illinois
resources.description: Statewide veteran organization providing member services and advocacy support to Illinois veterans.

resources.name: AMVETS - Illinois
resources.description: National veteran organization providing member services and advocacy in Illinois.

resources.name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) - Illinois
resources.address: 809 S. Grand Ave. W, Springfield, IL 62704
resources.description: National organization supporting disabled veterans with services and advocacy in Illinois.

resources.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) - Illinois
resources.description: National veteran organization providing member services and advocacy support in Illinois.

resources.name: Marine Corps League - Illinois
resources.description: Organization supporting Marine Corps veterans in Illinois with member services and advocacy.

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: National hotline connecting homeless or at-risk veterans to local services and assistance.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: Free, confidential crisis support for veterans and their families available 24/7.

resources.name: Illinois Joining Forces
resources.description: Non-legal veteran support services providing information and referrals to programs and assistance.

resources.name: Illinois Attorney General's Military and Veterans Rights Bureau
resources.description: Handles ISERRA violations, consumer scams targeting veterans, and benefits-related issues.
